intro: Trachymene longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-pedunculate devil's-bit, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and swampy areas. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
